PS2™ Classics
Emulator Compatibility List

Jump to navigation Jump to search


Compatibility counters at date: December 20, 2024  

PS2 Classic = 409   Playable = 1873   Minor Issues = 316   Major Issues = 93   Unplayable = 34


PS2 Classic  Syntax for wiki editors: {{ps2classic}}Released for the PS3 at the PlayStation Store, the compatibility is certified by Sony.
It works exactly like when you play it on a real PS2 Console, the compatibility is as good as {{playable}} 		GOOD
Compatibility
Playable  Syntax for wiki editors: {{playable}}Works perfect without any noticeable error.
It works exactly like when you play it on a real PS1 Console, the compatibility is as good as {{ps1classic}}
Minor Issues  Syntax for wiki editors: {{minorissues}}Framerate problems, audio/video desync, or other small and non-critical innacuracies.
It works fine and can be completed without any huge disadvantages for your gaming progress, the compatibility is near {{playable}}
Major Issues  Syntax for wiki editors: {{majorissues}}Very low framerate, screen flickering, glitched graphics, or non-critical broken functions.
It works but not good enough, it will be a pain for your gaming experience, the compatibility is near {{unplayable}} 		BAD
Compatibility
Unplayable  Syntax for wiki editors: {{unplayable}}Critical problems, doesn't boots, freezes or crashes after some gaming progress.
It doesn't works or can't be completed due to some critical problems at some point that doesn't allow the game to continue.
Available  Syntax for wiki editors: {{available}}Released for this region, but nobody tested it.
This tag is intended to be used temporally to indicate the existence of the game for an specific region but with an unknown compatibility. 		UNDEFINED
Compatibility
Not Available  Syntax for wiki editors: {{notavailable}}Not released for this region.
This tag is intended to be used in the regions where the game wasn't released, e.g: PAL-EU & NTSC-U of a game released only in Japan.

Tekken 4 Minor Issues Minor Issues Available Frame rate drops in high detailed environments like fog and water (Reduced if 60Hz mode and smoothing off). Some Story Battle ending FMVs have a tendency to crash and skip straight to the credits (unless viewed through Theatre Mode, but they suffer from annoying visual artifacts), with Jin Kazama's ending crashing the entire console. The PAL version works fine if you select 50Hz mode, but this mode is slower (not because of emulation issue; 50Hz caps the frame rate to 50 to match the refresh rate), and even then the game still slightly struggles in high detailed environments like the Laboratory and Arena stages
Tekken 5 Minor Issues Minor Issues Minor Issues All versions have stutter in some stages (Hidden Garden stage for example). The NTSC version has Progressive Scan but it causes constant screen shake. The Tekken Within mode also suffers from constant slowdowns, unable to retain a steady frame rate for the most part. An HD port of the game's updated version, Dark Resurrection Online, is available but lacks almost every mode from both the PS2 original and PSP Dark Resurrection versions, retaining a few staple modes like Arcade Battle, VS, and Survival.

Valkyrie Profile 2: Silmeria Playable Playable Playable Config fixes crashing after the PS2 boot logo. The 1080i mode present in the NTSC-J version does not work causing the video signal to lose. ATTENTION: Config files updated on 1.10.2021. Please delete all the saves made by the earlier CUSTOM config files, as the game will crash in the Chapter 5. Do not use any cheated saves or patched ISO files because the protection could be triggered.
